732438f-b.title: Occupations - Peddlers - Food - Fruit.
732438f-b.text:
Peddlers, Fruit: A market scene on Ninth Ave., near West 40th
Street, showing a retail general produce area. This is a set of 2 views.
1936.
Gift of Dr. Michael Wishengrad, A.R.P.S.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.

712694f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 9th Avenue
712694f-a.text:
Veat 40th Street (the immediate foreground) north side, between
Ninth and Tenth Avenues, shoing a clearance between this point and
West 41st Street. This, in conjunction with the buildings on the
north side of the latter point will form a portion of the new Dyer
Avenue, the aporoach to the new Lincoln Tunnel. The loft building
seen in the left background is on the north side of 42nd Street and
will r emain, to face the northern extremity of this vehicular roadway.
1arch 18, 1935.
P. L. Sperr,
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712687f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 9th Avenue
712687f-a.text:
3500, 34o, 344 West 40th Street, south side, east of Ninth Avenue
No. 34o is the Greek Orthodox Church of Saints Constantine and
Helen. which took this edifice over in 1925. (See 346-354 Wesf
40th Stneet, June 1E5). The edifice is shortly to give way t
a six-story garAge.
May 23, 1930.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUU1IONS.

712688f-a.text:

710392f-a.title: Manhattan: 9th Avenue - 40th Street (West)
710392f-a.text:
Ninth Ave., east side, north from West 40th Street and showing a
portion of a retail market area known popularly as ''Paddys Market5
which in the near future will disappear as same; the Lincoln Tunnel
traffic necessitating the removal of obstructions.
December 10, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712686f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 9th Avenue
712686f-a.text:
346, 350-352-354 West 40th Street, south side, east of Ninth
Avenue. No. 346, here erroneously labeled 350, is a former
German Methodist-Episcopal Church which has just been taken
over by the Greek Othodox Congregation of Saints Constantine
and Helen.
June, 192V.
MAY 6L REPRODUC1D.
